Class.ClassComment:
Group /** *

Identifies the key for a group.

@Group should be used when you have control over the key class. For example: 

 class User { ... String office; ... int hashCode() { // Defines the hash for the key, normally used to determine location ... } // Override the location by specifying a group, all keys in the same // group end up with the same owner
 * @Group String getOffice() { return office; } }

If you don't have control over the key class, you can specify a {@link Grouper} (in your configuration) which can be used tospecify the group externally.

You must set the groupsEnabled property to true in your configuration in order to use groups.

* @see Grouper * @author Pete Muir */
